intro: Schuebleria stricta, commonly known as the rigid schuebleria, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-drained soil. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape and often have a slightly hairy texture. Schuebleria stricta is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in shaded garden settings.
